inn1.comm: bangs it in short, gets some reasonable bounce but that bends away from the batsman and he shoulders arms
a little wider this time and that bends right away from the batsman who has no interest in chasing it
straighter and the batsman defends that one with a straight bat, showing the maker's mark perfectly
again that one was defended and this is tidy so far from Rainsford, right on the money there
a hint of swing again and that leaves the batsman, who leaves the ball in turn
more swing and Saleh leaves that well alone to bring up a maiden first off and that's a good start for Zimbabwe
the ball died slightly on its way through to the keeper past the batsman who left that well alone
that one died again, with a bit more movement away from the lefthander
good areas from Ireland and that one sailed through this time
the ball died once more and Saleh was quick to shoulder arms and leave that be
more of the same, the ball angling across the lefthander and once more he perfects his leave
ooh, that one kept a bit low and the batsman jabbed at that one but he left it as it went away from him
the batsman steers that one out to cover where it's tidily picked up and Bangladesh are still searching for their first run
left alone as that one sails down the off-side channel
runs at last! And they're cheered loudly by the crowd. Good hands, pushing that in front of square and that's his 1000th run in one-dayers. Well done that man
and more runs the very next ball! Struck more fluently this time, a lovely, balanced cover-drive which he threw his hands at, and that evades the diving fielder at cover and races away
very wide down the off-side, but the batsman had a bit of a head-rush and chased it with his bat, but it was too wide to reach
that one swung away from the righthander who slashed at it with an ugly swish
More bounce for this one - but only comparatively, it's still pretty low - hitting the dry section of the pitch and that leaves the batsman and finds the keeper
Ooh, uppish drive dropped by a diving Chigumbura in the covers. A difficult chance, low and to his right, and he got a hand to it but the chance went down.
wide of off-stump
an overstepped no-ball follows the wide
better from Ireland, pushed up and that's guided easily into the covers
left alone, excellent areas
left that one alone again, and that's a great seam position, stable and the ball arcs gently away from the lefthander
wider from the bowler and the batsman cracks a delicious cut but straight to point where it's leapt on and smothered
play and miss, the batsman was squared right up there by one which beats him with the lack of bounce. This pitch is showing some variation in bounce; it's quite heavily cracked
the batsman squares up to that to defend it and a thick outside edge flies low and out of danger
straighter line and that's defended
left alone
straighter and that's helped into the on-side

plumb! Not much doubt about that one, as the batsman shaped to pull but the ball failed to get up at all, and struck on the back leg just above the knee roll. The ball would have gone on to hit the top of off
defended into the covers
defended on the back foot this time
Straight drive is cut off by the man at mid-off who slides at full stretch. Typically good fielding from Zimbabwe, this
squeezed into the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on
strays right down leg
pushed right up there and that's defended into the covers
on the button and that's quickly defended by the batsman just outside the off stump
defended forward
defended on the front foot again
hit into the covers
good length delivery and that's defended once more
played that one away from the body, a cut on the back foot but that goes straight to the man at point who gets his body behind it
ooh! Another big appeal but that one's missing leg
whipped off the hips on the front foot and that races through the square-leg boundary
defended this time
banged in but that one doesn't get up - there's really not a lot of pace in this pitch at all - and the batsman has time to defend that on the back foot
hit out square to the boundary where it's winged back in
a bit wayward down the leg side and that's tucked away with the batsman taking his bottom hand off the bat on the follow-through of that shot
ooh, too straight from the bowler and the batsman is quickly onto that one helping it round to right behind him
straight drive but that's quickly picked up
worked off his hips and that's hit just behind square
that's a good length and that's straight and defended
defended into the covers
pushed right up there and defended once more

wide signalled and Rainsford puts his hands on his hips, but he can't argue with the umpire, that was really wide down off and the batsman gamely tries to lash that through covers but can't get anywhere near it
defended this time

strangled down the leg-side and that's really very well held by Taylor, diving low to his left and getting his left glove underneath it to scoop it up. That's a good decision from the umpire to match; the batsman just getting a shade of glove on it. Zimbabwe's tails are up pretty early on indeed
straight and the batsman isn't sure what to do with that so he leaves it and it crashes into him
squeezed off his hips and that one goes square

ooh, lovely delivery just moving away a little but from the lefthander who's in all sorts of difficulties and somehow fails to get an edge on it. Ireland asking all the questions here and Bangladesh don't have many answers
whipped to fine leg where it's comfortably picked up and returned
scrambled single
too straight and turned down to fine leg
thick inside edge to mid wicket
back of a length off the back foot to point
full and chopped to mid wicket, Zimbabwe keeping up the pressure
fuller and wider, batsman throws his arms at it and it flies over second slip - Bangladesh looking to be more positive now
Left outside off stump
jabs bat down on a length ball that keeps low, this is a slow, tough wicket to play shots on
wide once more and Taylor takes
too much width and Nafees climbs into a great cut behind square
guided to gully
too much width from the strawberry blond, needs to keep that line tight
Dropped onto the legside, Nafees once a single to Gary Brent but gets sent back - Brent shies and misses, would have been out
guided to gully again, Ireland looking tired as his radar begins to mis-fire
full and pushed wide of mid off for a single, nice looking shot from Saqibul
came back off the seam, huge appeal as it wraps him on the pads and heads to the boundary fine of third man - looks an unlucky decision for the bowler
a disappointed bowler flings this one full and wide of leg stump
shot of the day - straight past the bowler, full maker's name visible and his sponsor is thrilled
dropped on the off side from a good length
pushed to mid off - Fletcher and Strauss watching with interest
as I thought, Ireland looked a little tired in his last over - and Brent's first ball is run to third man for one
hammered to point and no run - missed out
wide and chopped into the off side
full length, driven back at the bowler and Brent settling into a tedious length
looks to play across the line, wraps him on the pad and the ball dribbles to slip
full and miscued onto the offside
the Zim allrounder's first ball jumps from this low, slow pitch and loops to a vacant silly point position - there are never enough silly points in place these days
turned to fine leg easily - too straight
straight again, blocked back to the bowler
throws his hands at it and it flies down to third man, the Tigers looking positive now, good running and trying to be aggressive
played at outside off stump the ball barely creeps above ground and dribbles to the keeper
full and pushed back to mid off
great stop from a great shot off the back foot, Strydom in the covers
pushed back to mid off
same again
crisp hit through the covers, superb
prodded back to cover off the back foot, this is actually a good line from Brent
mid on in the action now, slightly shorter
drove nicely through the line straight, great shot, Bengalis beginning to punish on length
clipped round to fine leg
that slow pitch saves the bowler, width but keeps low and Taylor scrambles round his knees
thick inside edge that finds midwicket
good fielding at mid off from the skipper, the Zimbaweans are looking good in the field
driven firmly to mid off
width, throws everything at it and cover dives full length making a great stop
dropped straight to mid off
this time he finds the gap and takes the single
plays and misses outside off stump, some bounce for the first time which surprises everyone
carefully watched and carefully played to cover - gritty, old-fashioned cricket
on the back foot, fended to cover, wants one but his partner wisely sends him back, especially considering the quality of the fielding
more width, more hands thrown through the ball and another great diving stop from Strydom
drops and goes, no one in close on the off side, the shy hits the stumps but he's well in
width and misses out
chopped into the offside - too much width here but he's getting away with it because of the slow pitch
straight and played to mid off
frustration now, dances down the wicket, swings, wraps him on the pad and they scramble through for a run
swinging hard but failing to time it, this is a tough pitch to play these shots
thrashed at cover, Bengalis looking frustrated still
attempted slower one, Nafees plays a premeditated swipe to the midwicket boundary
driven to long on
outside off stump, flashes at it but misses by a mile
on a good length, played down to third man
played back down the pitch
tries to cut, gets a bottom edge which flies past off stump and is well taken on the bounce by Taylor
worked out to midwicket and the single brings the 50 stand, it's been hard work but this pair are playing well
attempts to play it through the on side but the bowler fields in his follow through
defended down the track
superb shot, up and over extra cover and it races to the boundary
plays and misses outside off stump
for the second time he misses an attempt at a cut shot
guided down to third man
solid defence as Brent sticks to his tight line and length
first ball is on the money and played out to midwicket
driven firmly back to the bowler
hint of turn and Nafees plays a loose shot outside off stump
bat and pad close together as it goes back to the bowler
tries to work it off his pads but misses and the ball bobbles on the leg side
punched down to mid on and Utseya starts with an excellent maiden over
driven down to long off
played with the spin out to midwicket
nicely played down to long on to rotate the strike
good length, played into the off side
powerful drive but goes straight to the man at extra cover to end a tight first over
neat drive down the ground where long off does the fielding
picks the gap at extra cover this time and there is time to complete a brace
turned behind square on the leg side
too short and Nafees rocks back and finds the gap between short third man and point, the ball races across the outfield to the fence
on the front foot, played out to cover
same shot, same result as Utseya finds his line again
used his feet and slotted the ball down to long off
this time off the back foot as this pair continue to rotate the strike
worked down to long on
can't find the gap at midwicket
this time he picks out square leg so is left one short of his fifty
arm ball taken off the stumps and out to point
comes down the track but defends as he doesn't quite get to the pitch
attempted sweep but doesn't connect and the ball falls behind the batsman, pressure building again
played with a straight bat to the bowler
beautiful shot, great footwork as he chips down the pitch and goes inside out over extra cover
worked into the off side
Bangladesh reach three figures with a chip to long off
there's his fifty with a drive to long off, well played
worked round the corner to short fine-leg
worked into the gap at cover
can't beat the on-side field
another well-taken single into the off side
worked up the ground to long on
punched out to midwicket
driven firmly down the ground but long off is quickly onto it
played out to cover
backs away outside leg stump and slots the ball through cover
swept out to backward square-leg
down the leg side and signalled by umpire Bucknor
struck down to long on and the fielder keeps them to a single

brilliant catch, went back to give himself room to cut but the ball bounced a little more than he expected on this slow pitch and he couldn't keep it down. Rainsford flung himself to his left at backward point and held the chance inches off the turf. Big wicket for Zimbabwe
that's the first run of the tournament for Bashar
played back to the bowler
played out to the on side
defended on the front foot
easily driven forward without much power
stays on his backfoot, a leaden-footed attempt to drive
swept to deep square leg
waits for the ball and hits into midwicket off the back foot
defended forward
dances down to meet the ball which he takes off his toes and whips through to the gap between midwicket and mid-on
nicely bowled, well flighted and that one lands just in front of his toes, where he comes forward to defend
swept just behind square where it's easily gathered and winged back in
down the track this time and crashes the ball with the toe end of his bat into his foot
this is better, slightly better timing and that rushes out square for a leisurely single
lovely shot, swings his arms and launches that over mid-on, good use of his feet
pushed right up there and that's well defended
Aw, lovely shot. Came down the track and thwacked that right over mid-on with a great deal of power and middle
waited for the ball this time and drops softs hands  over the ball which he caresses behind point
cut off the back foot through point, nicely struck
driven to cover
speared in and that's defended
crouched over the ball and that's helped into midwicket
big lone shout from the bowler but that pitched outside off and would have missed the sticks comfortably
defended
defended once more
cut to the man in at cover and that's a good over from the bowler
comes down the track and that's driven back slowly to the bowler
came down to meet that again with one step and that's driven to mid-on
authoritative shot over mid-wicket and that rockets away to the boundary
defended
another quiet defensive finishes the over
that one was straightish and the batsman got over it to lazily guide it out just wide of mid-on
forceful drive to mid-on
another drive to mid-on
driven out to long-on
cut to gully
defended
cut out behind point
on the button and that's defended
did well to teach out for that and slog sweep it to the boundary
a very quick single from a dab down, well taken
came down the track and tried to drive it but didn't quite hold of it and the bowler picks it up easily
stroked slowly to midwicket
driven to cover
swept down to just behind square
driven to midwicket this time
on the button and that's defended this time
one-bounce drive to the fielder at mid-off
the batsman has a huge hoick at that one and completely misses it; it comes off his body and goes behind for a single as it bounces off Taylor's gloves
reaches out for that one and rushes it through to the midwicket boundary
lovely aerial cover drive for four, opening up his hands to dispatch that one and Bangladesh are certainly picking up the pace here
hit into the covers where a brace of fielders rush to secure the ball
pushed on to the back foot this time to defend with a straight bat
squeezed into the leg side
a big whoosh into midwicket
pushed on to the back foot and defended
square driven through point
struck sweetly into midwicket
call for the third umpire after the stumps are taken by Taylor from an underarm shy from short midwicket but the batsman snuck home at Taylor's end after a very risky single
blocked to mid on
driven to mid off and easy single
down the wicket and big swing over the legside for the first six of the innings
follows this with a glorious, full swinging drive finding the gap at mid off, Nafees really accelerating now
Bahsar joins in the fun swinging to midwicket
attempted cut and misses out
this times makes contact and finds a gap in the covers
too straight and off the thigh pad down to fine leg
turned to mid wicket
uses feet and chips to mid on
in the block hole, pace man back and doing the stuff straight away
full outside off driven to third man
watchfully played to midwicket
hits the fielder at cover
low full toss, hit to deep square takes him to 99
strong hit over mid on and one bounce into the crowd

runs it to third man for his second 100 in ODIs - he looks delighted, hugs his partner and it has been a great knock. Arms are in the air, he takes off his cap (it's been good to see him helmetless for the last 20 overs) - and that's a huge grin
full and in the block hole - clever death bowling
big drive and the bowler stops it in his follow through
full, gives himself room, looks to smash it over cover for a maximum but all his ambitions are shattered by Rainsford's accuracy
played out to midwicket
clipped firmly to midwicket once more
full and straight and clipped like a king through midwicket
he's picking his spots now, finding the space at wide fine leg by moving across his stumps
whacked out to deep midwicket, already seven off the over
wide of off stump, lucky not to be called, plays and misses
more width, another swing but can only find the bottom of the bat and it loops to extra cover. Tough pitch to come in and smash it around on - he's made a duck
width again, but this time the batsman finds the middle and gives it a meaty thump to the gap at extra cover
big hit to long off and a fumble allows them to come back for two, not what Zimbabwe want
just short of a length and Nafees plays a pull drive to that gap at straight midwicket, he's cashed in there a lot this innings
looks to hit over extra cover and misses - better length from Rainsford
misses the stumps and the bat, just - that shaved the blue-painted wickets - Nafees needs to hit calmly now
swings again to leg, misses again and dribbles to gully from his pads
deep ring fielder in the offside gathers
medium pace at the death, a huge swipe and a thick outside edge flies to the gap at deep backward point
the keeper standing up pins the players to the crease and he can only drive to mid off
good straight hit from a full ball
the slower ball does for him, that bottom hand comes through too quickly and he holes out to deep mid on - it was bright but brief from Bangladesh's quick bowler
good full delivery that is run to third man
tries to smash it over cover and thick outside edge is picked up by third man
turned to fine leg
ugly heave runs to the gap at wide fine leg
great death bowling, makes room and the ball is fired in at his feet
full and chopped back to the bowler who half stops it
chipped to mid off and that's Raisnford's lot - he's bowled well at the start and death, with anger and great energy
good change of pace, but the batsman gives himself room
a tired swipe from Nafees who chips it to a mid off who's deep, he scrambles forward, leaps and puts down a tough chance - Chibhabha is the fielder
swing and a miss and catches the keeper on the arm
full and whacked at point who can't quite gather cleanly
slow one again and swung to deep midwicket
that's the shot patented by Andrew Strauss, steps across his stumps and flicks it to fine leg but can only chip it short of Ireland
chopped out to deep point
full and clubbed past the bowler with an extraordinary piece of improvisation - good fielding though
width and slapped to cover for one
more width and a swipe over point
that Strauss shot again but it hits his pad and the bowler can't stop them taking the run
last ball is smeared to midwicket and that's it for Bangladesh

inn2.comm: good start from Mortaza, short of a length and it climbs past the edge and carries nicely through to the keeper
fuller ball this time, attacking the stumps, and it's work to midwicket
raps the pads but is drifting down the leg side
again drifting a little too straight and the batsman uses the pace of the ball to work it behind square as Zimbabwe open their chase
worked down to third man off the front foot
solid forward defence by Taylor, who has been moved up to the opening position for this innings
outside off stump and through to the keeper
pitched on the stumps and the batsman lunges forward, Reza fields in his follow through
offered a touch more width and the Chibhabha frees his arms, slicing the ball through backward point with an open face and the ball speeds away
again an open face, but this one goes finer - past gully - and down to third man
defended off the front foot, Reza is nothing more than medium pace
driven towards cover point, who lets the ball through his hands and gifts Zimbabwe a single
another fumble by Bangladesh, this time by Bashar at mid on. They can't afford to give away runs
defended into the covers
Mortaza finding good areas and the batsman flashes outside off stump but the ball just misses the edge
blocked on the front foot but Chibhabha doesn't look very comfortable
shoulders arms as the ball shapes away
another excellent delivery which squares the batsman up in defence. Mortaza has started well here and is keeping the Zimbabweans on their toes
forced out to midwicket with a straight bat, Reza doesn't get much bounce
driven on the up by Taylor but doesn't quite beat mid off who bends down and collects with his left hand
tries to work the ball into the gap at square leg but it just takes the pad
confidently driven to mid off. Taylor has often looked the most correct Zimbabwe batsman, if only he could see off the new ball
pushed down to mid off
another solid shot which is fielded by mid off
the bowler starts to go up in appeal but the ball is heading well down the leg side
connects well with this one and finds the gap at cover with an open face, not quite enough power to reach the fence but some good running
superb timing through square leg as Mortaza drifts too straight again and a welcome boundary for Taylor
Mortaza gets his line back and the batsman comes forward with a strong defensive shot
played off the front foot again and fielded by point
sharp single into the covers, it will be important that Zimbabwe run well in this innings
well fielded by Razzaq at mid off who dives to his left and probably saves three runs from a powerful drive
sweetly struck through the gap between mid on and midwicket. Just fractionally off line and the batsman cashed in
hammered off the back foot but straight to the fielder at cover
comes forward, fielded by the man at midwicket
pushed towards mid on and a sharp single is scampered, direct hit but the batsman is home
played from the crease, back to the bowler
defended on the move as Mortaza pitches up

this one is right on line and Chibhabha tries to play it through the on side, the ball straightens slightly and strikes the front pad just above the ankle. That is heading for middle and leg and Bangladesh have their first breakthrough
that was close as well, as Masakadza lunges forward and is struck on the pad. But umpire Harper gives him the benefit of the doubt although replays show it is very close
gets bat onto this one and it goes out into the off side
behind this with a solid defensive shot
inside edge and bounces over the stumps leaving Taylor to field
takes the bottom hand off the bat, showing he wasn't in complete control, and the ball rolls out to cover
more power in this shot as both hands stay on the bat, again fielded by cover
comes forward and drives the ball into the on side
short of a length and Taylor forces off the back foot, down to mid on
driven firmly to short extra-cover, who parries the ball over his head and mid-off tidies up
excellent delivery from Mortaza which pitches and seams away from Taylor, who is left prodding at thin air
another cracker which Taylor can only waft at as it moves away
slightly straighter this time and it connects with the middle of the bat
doesn't really get forward and the ball strikes the bottom half of the bat and dribbles back to the bowler
fuller and driven to cover where the fielder, Reza, dives and collects in one hand before throwing it quickly towards the non-striker's end but just misses the stumps. That was a tight run
forced into the on side as Mortaza's fine start continues
driven firmly and it bounces over the man at short extra, allowing the batsmen a single as mid off fields
stunning straight drive, simple execution as Taylor punches through the line and sends the ball racing past the stumps and down to the fence
slower ball crisply turned into midwicket and mid on is forced to dive to his right to save the boundary
defended down to mid off
behind this one with a straight bat
driven up to mid off to end the first 10 overs
defensive on the back foot
that's defended once more, good delivery
Mortaza lets out a small grunt as he delivers the ball with extra effort; it pitches and moves in at the righthander who fends it off
angled in at the righthander again who comes forward cautiously and yet is deliberate in offering a straight-batted defensive, crouching and facing towards cover as he finishes
that pitches in line with off stump and that's defended

soft run out - classic mix-up and Zimbabwe pay the price with Masakadza sacrificing himself. Taylor middled the ball with a good shot which took the opposing stumps and the richochet was quickly gathered and returned to the keeper who waited and took the stumps. Taylor set off and Masakadza was stranded in no-man's land, and he crossed with the scampering Taylor to let that batsman stay in.
softly driven to cover
speared right up and that's a huge call as the ball raps the batsman on the pad, but it looked to be turning too much and missing leg
another appeal, this time from the keeper, who pulls out of the appeal at the last minute
decent tight bowling and the batsman can only jab down on that one at the last
ooh, a very big appeal on the front foot but that's turned down because of a big step forward. That looked fairly close
defended this time
beautiful shot turned round off the legs and played well on the on-side, through midwicket
hit to just in front of point without much power
steered to mid on and that's a confident shout for a single
thick edge from an attempted cover drive rolls down to third man
whipped with his wrists, a la Pietersen, round to midwicket: smart batting and that's some lovely timing there
ooh, a sliver of a chance. That was a big outside edge as Taylor shaped to drive but it just evaded the outstretched right paw of the keeper
speared right up there and that's defended on the front foot with a solid bat
guided to cover
defended on the front foot as that pitches on off stump
that's a huge shout, pitching on off stump and going pretty straight and yet the umpire isn't interested
that's left alone this time
hit out to cover point
scrambled two that was comfortable in the end
left alone
comes forward to defend that one this time
defended again
strayed down leg and that's picked up off his toes and flicked casually and effectively behind square
ooh, that one almost sneaked through but the batsman got a fine edge on it in the end, which clattered into his pads and the bowler can't believe it, rubbing his hair
straight and that's defended forward, probing length from Razzaq, allowing no width at all and forcing the batsman to play
defended once more
another defensive shot and the spinners are applying the squeeze here all right
a big swoosh at that one flies through under his edge
on the button once more and the batsman can only defend again
rare runs off Razzaq, and this was a glorious four struck sweetly, a glorious flick off the legs through midwicket and there was a despairing dive on the boundary, to no end
chopped a bump ball straight to backward point
the ball skidded on that was ticked fine for two hasty runs
hit to mid-on
dropped that one a touch short and that's firmly struck to cover but well fielded
tried to work that very fine but failed to get hold of it and it crashes into the pads
lovely ball, moved away from the righthander with some juicy turn and he just failed to get an edge on it
a big shout, the bowler on his front knee in appeal and that hits the batsman straight in front but the umpire turns it down
a nice yorker this time and the batsman just jabs his bat down at the last minute
defended forward
defended on the back foot this time
the batsman tries to on-drive that one but doesn't quite get hold of it and that's picked up by the bowler to complete a well-bowled maiden
attempts a drive but that's picked up by the bowler
hit out softly to square leg
cleaned him right up with a quicker one that rocketed against the pads off the bat and straight into the sticks. This wicket was always on the cards with Strydom struggling against the spin.
ah, a big shout first up but Umpire Harper turns that one down because he got a stride in
defended with a straight bat
defended once more
speared up in the blockhole and that's defended once more; the squeeze is really on Zimbabwe now
big leading edge against the spin balloons up and lands in space at long-on
defended again
defended into the covers
defended on the front foot this time
nicely struck; just waited for the ball to come to him a fraction longer and that's guided into midwicket
driven back to mid on for a single
tries to work a straight ball square on the off side
drives straighter this time
worked to midwicket
paddle sweep to man at 45, that's him off the mark
plays outside off stump, balls spin and Mashud takes off the bails, they've gone for a reply, he looks safe, just gets the toe back in time
punched back to the bowler
blocked to cover
straight to mid on
single off the last ball with a push to cover which only gives Taylor the one ball, not ideal batting
Taylor cannot farm the strike and plays and misses as the ball bounces and spins
pushed to cover
blocked to the bowler
finds the gap at mid off, misfield leads to the second
clipped through midwicket, great timing, that's better
better over for Zim, dropped to midwicket
turned round to deep backward square leg

dear oh dear, Taylor has worked it to deep backward square, turned for a quick second but Matsikenyeri has not moved - poor Taylor looked up to see his partner unmoved at the other end. For the second time in the innings, Taylor sprints passed a partner, running him out.
worked to long off
allrounder Chigumbura faces his first ball and takes one to square leg from a thick inside edge
pushed to mid off and Taylor doesn't want another run out
muted celebrations from Taylor for his fifty, late cut passed short third man but Zim are in bother
blocked to cover
loud appeal for ball slipping down the leg
mid off kept busy again after a nice drive
driven into the covers but finds the gap
blocked and the bowler fields
driven down to mid on and they trot through
trying to use his feet but he's finding it hard to get away
looks dangerous this, Taylor's been dragged out of his crease, over-balanced and Mashud has whipped off the bails. They are going to the third umpire but Taylor has walked. That could be it...
guided to short third man
turned behind square on the legside
on leg stump and padded away
pushed to mid on
mis-reads the length and tries to cut a full ball, Mashud grabs it
pushed back to mid off
couldn't pick his nose, it bounced and turned passed the outside edge, missed it by at least two bats' worth
big shout with a good stride, which probably saves him, that was very straight
bit of bounce and prodded on the offside
the bowler gathers another block
that familiar ZIm block comes out again, the run rates creeping up
played out to cover
toppled over but manages to squirt it to midwicket
blocked to square leg and the keeper fields
driven into the offside
wide of the crease but manages to play it to long on
dribbles out on the on side
more offside prodding
attempted sweep but missed again
clipped out to midwicket
firmly driven down to long off, but Zimbabwe need boundaries
clubbed straight to long off
angled out to point
down to long off again
nearly a mix-up in the running as the ball drops into the leg side but Chigumbura makes his ground at the non-striker's end
can't beat backward point as he steers the ball away
thick inside-edge past the stumps to short fine-leg
takes the pad into the leg side
into the off side
loud appeal for lbw, but struck just outside the line of off stump
blocked into the leg side as the required rate continues to climb
driven up to long on
down the pitch, makes it into a full toss but picks out midwicket
finds the vacant mid on area this time and the man on the fence cleans up
pushed down the ground
turned square but again it's just a single
the tip and run continues but still no sign of the big shots
played on the up and a fine diving save from the bowler
plays this from the crease and works down to long on
comes forward and drives square through point to the sweeper on the fence
again keeps the man on the fence busy
straight to midwicket and Brent is struggling to get the ball away
back to the bowler and Zimbabwe are not really going anywhere here. They may as well have a dip and see what they can do.
pushed out to midwicket
down to long on
turned to short fine-leg
pushed into the leg side and they scamper a quick single
wow, something more than a single as the batsmen sprint two from a well-placed drive into the covers
back to the bowler, who fumbles and they get one to long off
straight ball played out into the on side
can't break the field as mid on collects
this time he hits it with enough power to get the ball down the ground to long on
back to the bowler
comes forward but can only block it down the pitch
tries to sweep, misses and is taken on the pad well outside the line of the off stump. Saqibul's fine spell continues
in the air but past the bowler and down to long off
Rafique does the fielding at long off
straight to midwicket
struck back to Saleh who fields at the second attempt
off the pad, down into the leg side
punched out to deep cover
guess what? yep, it's blocked
defended out to cover with too much power to get a single
out to point and no one is going anywhere very quickly
forced out to the man on the cover boundary
down to long on
bit more flight from Rafique and Brent misses his cut shot
long off again in action but Bangladesh won't worry about the ones
and they'll worry even less about the scoreless deliveries
sorry, I've run out of ways to describe a single...so it's a single into the on side
tries to sweep but doesn't connect

stunning effort from Saqibul as the batsman tries to turn the ball away and gets a leading edge high into the on side. There is no one fielding inside the ring so Saqibul has to make the ground himself and completes the catch with a fine diving catch
outside edge to short third man
and another one bites the dust as Brent gets a huge top edge to an attempted sweep which is safely pouched by Bashar at midwicket
worked out to midwicket
inside edge but falls just wide of the stumps
Pushed forward
Pushed forward and a big appeal but not out
Prodding forward, as opposed to a push - big difference
driven to mid off
batting for a draw now, as he leaves it outside off stump
wraps him in front once more, stifled appeal
pushed back to bowler
driven to mid on
that's done the batsman, keeper but not the stumps, between bat and pad
turned round and fielded by Mashud
pushed back once more to the bowler - batting for pride now
that's blocked once more, off an inside edge and the smiling Sakib is finished, only costing 18 - great bowling
blocked, blocked, blocked - just over 13 an over needed now
that was more of a poke back to the bowler
attempted drive dribbles into the off
driven down the ground, much more bat on it this time
and that's the end of Ireland, a swipe across the line and the experienced Rafique hits the leg stump - not sure where he was trying to hit that, but at least he didn't block it - again...
huge appeal on Rafique's last ball - screaming for more success, but he's won the game with his tight, accurate spin
plays and misses outside off from the quick bowler - huge relief that the spin drought has finished
clobbered through the off to the cover sweeper
blocked back to mid off
short ball, attempted pull and balloons over a vacant short leg
driven nicely but stopped at point
full but can't find a way through, blocked back to the bowler
there are still six inside the circle, dribbles out towards that backward square
another one falls, big swipe across the line trying to keep up with that uber-run rate and it rattles the middle poll. That ball started straight, bounced straight and hit straight, unlike the shot
pushed back to mid off
and that's it, game over. He goes back to one that he should be forward to, it careers past a flapping bat, taking out all three.
